gospel.text:
[[Mc 1,40]]A leper came to him and kneeling down begged him and said, "If you wish, you can make me clean."
[[Mc 1,41]]Moved with pity, he stretched out his hand, touched him, and said to him, "I do will it. Be made clean."
[[Mc 1,42]]The leprosy left him immediately, and he was made clean.
[[Mc 1,43]]Then, warning him sternly, he dismissed him at once.
[[Mc 1,44]]Then he said to him, "See that you tell no one anything, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses prescribed; that will be proof for them."
[[Mc 1,45]]The man went away and began to publicize the whole matter. He spread the report abroad so that it was impossible for Jesus to enter a town openly. He remained outside in deserted places, and people kept coming to him from everywhere.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

first_reading.text:
[[He 3,7]]The holy Spirit says: "Oh, that today you would hear his voice,
[[He 3,8]]'Harden not your hearts as at the rebellion in the day of testing in the desert,
[[He 3,9]]where your ancestors tested and tried me and saw my works
[[He 3,10]]for forty years. Because of this I was provoked with that generation and I said, "They have always been of erring heart, and they do not know my ways."
[[He 3,11]]As I swore in my wrath, "They shall not enter into my rest."'"
[[He 3,12]]Take care, brothers, that none of you may have an evil and unfaithful heart, so as to forsake the living God.
[[He 3,13]]Encourage yourselves daily while it is still "today," so that none of you may grow hardened by the deceit of sin.
[[He 3,14]]We have become partners of Christ if only we hold the beginning of the reality firm until the end.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews

psalm.text:
[[Ps 95,6]]Come, let us bow down in worship;
let us kneel before the LORD who made us.
[[Ps 95,7]]For he is our God, 
and we are the people he shepherds, the flock he guides.

[[Ps 95,8]]Oh, that today you would hear his voice:
“Harden not your hearts as at Meribah, 
as in the day of Massah in the desert,
[[Ps 95,9]]Where your fathers tempted me; 
they tested me though they had seen my works.”  

[[Ps 95,10]]Forty years I was wearied of that generation; 
I said: “This people's heart goes astray, 
they do not know my ways.”
[[Ps 95,11]]Therefore I swore in my anger: 
“They shall never enter my rest.”
psalm.title: Psalms
